faqs_list.title: What is GDPR?
faqs_list.faq_body: DATA PRIVACY PROTECTION IS OUR HUUUGE RESPONSIBILITY [If you want to submit a request pursuant to GDPR, click Contact Us] What is GDPR? The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a data protection and privacy regulation within the European Union and the European Economic Area (EEA). The goal of GDPR is to give individuals in the European Union control over their personal data and to unify data privacy and protections laws within the European Countries. What is Personal Data under GDPR? In the context of GDPR, ‘Personal Data’ refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’). What Personal Data do we collect? The personal data Huuuge collects can be divided into three categories: 1. Data you provide to us ● Contact information (such as full name and email address) ● Profile information (such as age or gender or photograph) ● Your messages to the Service (such as chat logs and player support tickets) ● Other data you choose to give us 2. Data we collect automatically Data about your account and in-game progress Your IP address and mobile device identifiers (such as your device ID, advertising ID) Data about your device, such as device manufacturer, model, operating system and language General location data like country or city name Data about your use of the Service, such as gameplay data and your interactions with other players inside the games 3. Data we receive from our partners ● Data we receive if you link your Facebook account with our game ● Data to fight fraud (such as refund abuse in games or click fraud in advertising) ● Data from platforms that the games run on ● Data for advertising and analytics purposes, so we can provide you a better Service Why do we collect this data? This is probably the first question on your mind. First of all, we require this data to make our games work (from creating accounts to enabling you to connect to our games, including verifying your payments). Further, in an effort to continually make our games better, we are also using your data to develop and improve player experience, respond to your questions and provide support, manage our relationship with you, and enable you to communicate with other players. We may also use personal data to show you personalized advertisements tailored to your preferences. Last, but certainly not least, personal data is used to keep our services safe and fair by analyzing and monitoring the use of our games and social features. It enables us to take action against specific players involved in inappropriate behavior from in-game toxicity to cheating and fraud. In all of the above cases we may analyze, profile and segment all collected data as needed. What is Huuuge doing to protect your Personal Data? ● Using all appropriate technical, organizational and logistic measures to keep your data secure ● Notifying authorities of personal data breaches, if necessary ● Obtaining appropriate consent for data processing, if required ● Keeping records detailing data processing ● Providing privacy training for all our personnel ● Auditing and updating our data policies ● Employing a Data Protection Officer What are your rights under GDPR? Your rights as a data subject under GDPR include the following: Reviewing your personal data Upon your request, we will provide you with a copy of all your personal data stored in our systems in an easy-to access electronic format. Erasing your personal data You may request, under certain conditions, to have your personal data erased at any time. Please be advised that by erasing your personal data, all game progress will be also be deleted and you will no longer be able to log in and play. This process cannot be undone, deleted accounts cannot be recovered. Please do not remove our game before submitting a deletion request, as we may not be able to verify your identity in that case. Anonymized copies of some data (e.g. game logs) may remain in our database for some time. Please consult our Privacy Policy for more details (see below). Opting-in or opting-out of email communication You may opt-in or opt-out of receiving additional communications, such as marketing emails or newsletters, from us by using the options provided in the game under Settings -> Edit -> Profile -> Edit. Other types of requests Correcting your personal data Transferring your personal data Objecting to certain processing activities Restricting data processing under certain circumstances Opting-in or opting-out of personalized advertising You can submit any of these request to our Support team through the in-game Help option, found in Settings (FAQ). Our Support team is also happy to answer any further questions you may have. You can find our detailed Privacy Policy in our in-game FAQ or at http://www.huuugegames.com/privacy-policy

faqs_list.title: Huuge’s compliance with the DSA & reporting illegal content for users in EU
faqs_list.faq_body: What is the EU Digital Services Act (DSA)? The EU Digital Services Act is a legislative framework proposed by the European Union to update and enhance regulations on digital services. Addressing illegal content aims to create a safer and more accountable online environment. The DSA focuses on several key objectives such as: - Ensuring online safety by combating illegal content. - Increasing transparency and accountability of digital services. - Protecting fundamental rights of users. Illegal Content under DSA - for users in European Union How to report Illegal Content? Users located in the European Union can report Illegal Content via Player Support directly through the game's automated support system or via our web Huuuge Games Support Portal or via e-mail support@huuugegames.com It’s important that you include in your report the following information, so we can act accordingly: -       explain clearly why you deem the content is illegal, -       specify the location and details of the allegedly illegal content, e.g.  the exact URL(s) (if applicable) or other information to identify illegal content such as screenshots. -       provide us with your name and e-mail address, except where the illegal content refers to offences concerning children sexual abuse, child pornography or similar, -       state that your report is done in a good faith, accurate and complete. What is Illegal Content? Illegal content that potentially may occur e.g. in our chat or club, content provided by our users, as defined by the EU Digital Services Act (DSA), includes information that does not comply with EU law or specific national laws within the EU. Illegality of the content can also originate from the principles of social coexistence. Here are some examples that may help you understand what content may be deemed illegal by us if reported: 1. Hate Speech Content that includes incitement to violence or hatred against individuals or groups based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or other characteristics protected under EU law. 2. Terrorism-related Content Content that promotes, supports, or incites terrorist activities or provides instructions for making explosives, weapons, or other dangerous substances. 3. Child Sexual Abuse Material Any material that depicts the sexual exploitation or abuse of children, including images, videos, or written content. 4. Counterfeit Goods Listings for the sale of counterfeit goods that infringe on intellectual property rights, such as fake branded clothes, electronics, or pharmaceuticals. 5. Fraudulent Schemes Content that promotes scams or fraudulent activities, including phishing schemes, pyramid schemes, and deceptive financial services. 6. Drugs and Illicit Substances Content that sells, offers, or promotes the use or distribution of illegal drugs or controlled substances. 7. Defamation and Invasion of Privacy Content that unlawfully defames individuals or invades their privacy, including unauthorized sharing of personal data, images, or videos. 8. Incitement to Self-Harm Content that encourages or instructs individuals to self-harm or commit suicide. It's important to note that the definition of illegal content can vary based on specific national laws within the EU. 9. Cyberstalking Using of digital communication tools to harass, intimidate, or threaten someone. It often involves repeated, unwanted contact, monitoring, or the spread of harmful information. Remember that the content or conduct highlighted above is only an illustration. How do we act in cases of Illegal Content? We will investigate and act accordingly to prevent Illegal Content in the following cases: -       when we receive report from a user, -       when we receive report form an authority, -       when we detect the Illegal Content by ourselves via our human reviewers or potentially when we employ automatic tools to moderate content. We have the right to impose the following restrictions on the user that disseminates Illegal content: removal of the content, temporary blocking (mute) the services for the user, suspension and/or termination of the services, prohibition of the future access to our services. Please also consult Section 13 of our Terms of Use for more information about conduct and prohibited use. Upon implementation restriction on the user disseminating Illegal Content, we will provide the statement of reasons. Users that do not agree with the restrictions imposed by us as a result of the above procedure have the right to file a complaint through the game's automated support system or online at Huuuge Games Support Portal . Please provide all the details regarding your complaint against the restrictions imposed by us as a result of this procedure so we are able to review it accordingly. Please also consult Section 15 of our Terms of Use for more information about complaints. Where can I find more information on the DSA? For more detailed information, visit the official [European Commission DSA webpage]( https://commission.europa.eu/strategy-and-policy/priorities-2019-2024/europe-fit-digital-age/digital-services-act_en ) or consult with legal experts specializing in EU digital regulations. Single point of contact for authorities and users in DSA matters Huuuge has established an electronic point of contact for direct communication with the authorities of the Member States, the European Commission, and the Digital Services Board: support@huuugegames.com . Users can also use this contact for swift and direct communication with Huuuge regarding any DSA issues. Please refer clearly to DSA and provide us with as many details as possible so we can act accordingly. All communication with the point of contact should be conducted in English. Transparency report We will periodically, at least once a year, publish transparency reports about our content moderation activities in compliance with DSA.

The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a data protection and privacy regulation within the European Union and the European Economic Area (EEA). The goal of GDPR is to give individuals in the European Union control over their personal data and to unify data privacy and protections laws within the European Countries. What is Personal Data under GDPR? In the context of GDPR, ‘Personal Data’ refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’). What Personal Data do we collect? The personal data Huuuge collects can be divided into three categories: 1. Data you provide to us ● Contact information (such as full name and email address) ● Profile information (such as age or gender or photograph) ● Your messages to the Service (such as chat logs and player support tickets) ● Other data you choose to give us 2. Data we collect automatically Data about your account and in-game progress Your IP address and mobile device identifiers (such as your device ID, advertising ID) Data about your device, such as device manufacturer, model, operating system and language General location data like country or city name Data about your use of the Service, such as gameplay data and your interactions with other players inside the games 3. Data we receive from our partners ● Data we receive if you link your Facebook account with our game ● Data to fight fraud (such as refund abuse in games or click fraud in advertising) ● Data from platforms that the games run on ● Data for advertising and analytics purposes, so we can provide you a better Service Why do we collect this data? This is probably the first question on your mind. First of all, we require this data to make our games work (from creating accounts to enabling you to connect to our games, including verifying your payments). Further, in an effort to continually make our games better, we are also using your data to develop and improve player experience, respond to your questions and provide support, manage our relationship with you, and enable you to communicate with other players. We may also use personal data to show you personalized advertisements tailored to your preferences. Last, but certainly not least, personal data is used to keep our services safe and fair by analyzing and monitoring the use of our games and social features. It enables us to take action against specific players involved in inappropriate behavior from in-game toxicity to cheating and fraud. In all of the above cases we may analyze, profile and segment all collected data as needed. What is Huuuge doing to protect your Personal Data? ● Using all appropriate technical, organizational and logistic measures to keep your data secure ● Notifying authorities of personal data breaches, if necessary ● Obtaining appropriate consent for data processing, if required ● Keeping records detailing data processing ● Providing privacy training for all our personnel ● Auditing and updating our data policies ● Employing a Data Protection Officer What are your rights under GDPR? Your rights as a data subject under GDPR include the following: Reviewing your personal data Upon your request, we will provide you with a copy of all your personal data stored in our systems in an easy-to access electronic format. Erasing your personal data You may request, under certain conditions, to have your personal data erased at any time. Please be advised that by erasing your personal data, all game progress will be also be deleted and you will no longer be able to log in and play. This process cannot be undone, deleted accounts cannot be recovered. Please do not remove our game before submitting a deletion request, as we may not be able to verify your identity in that case. Anonymized copies of some data (e.g. game logs) may remain in our database for some time. Please consult our Privacy Policy for more details (see below). Opting-in or opting-out of email communication You may opt-in or opt-out of receiving additional communications, such as marketing emails or newsletters, from us by using the options provided in the game under Settings -> Edit -> Profile -> Edit. Other types of requests Correcting your personal data Transferring your personal data Objecting to certain processing activities Restricting data processing under certain circumstances Opting-in or opting-out of personalized advertising You can submit any of these request to our Support team through the in-game Help option, found in Settings (FAQ). Our Support team is also happy to answer any further questions you may have. You can find our detailed Privacy Policy in our in-game FAQ or at http://www.huuugegames.com/privacy-policy

faqs_list.title: Huuge’s compliance with the DSA & reporting illegal content for users in EU
faqs_list.faq_body: What is the EU Digital Services Act (DSA)? The EU Digital Services Act is a legislative framework proposed by the European Union to update and enhance regulations on digital services. Addressing illegal content aims to create a safer and more accountable online environment. The DSA focuses on several key objectives such as: - Ensuring online safety by combating illegal content. - Increasing transparency and accountability of digital services. - Protecting fundamental rights of users. Illegal Content under DSA - for users in European Union How to report Illegal Content? Users located in the European Union can report Illegal Content via Player Support directly through the game's automated support system or via our web Huuuge Games Support Portal or via e-mail support@huuugegames.com It’s important that you include in your report the following information, so we can act accordingly: -       explain clearly why you deem the content is illegal, -       specify the location and details of the allegedly illegal content, e.g.  the exact URL(s) (if applicable) or other information to identify illegal content such as screenshots. -       provide us with your name and e-mail address, except where the illegal content refers to offences concerning children sexual abuse, child pornography or similar, -       state that your report is done in a good faith, accurate and complete. What is Illegal Content? Illegal content that potentially may occur e.g. in our chat or club, content provided by our users, as defined by the EU Digital Services Act (DSA), includes information that does not comply with EU law or specific national laws within the EU. Illegality of the content can also originate from the principles of social coexistence. Here are some examples that may help you understand what content may be deemed illegal by us if reported: 1. Hate Speech Content that includes incitement to violence or hatred against individuals or groups based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or other characteristics protected under EU law. 2. Terrorism-related Content Content that promotes, supports, or incites terrorist activities or provides instructions for making explosives, weapons, or other dangerous substances. 3. Child Sexual Abuse Material Any material that depicts the sexual exploitation or abuse of children, including images, videos, or written content. 4. Counterfeit Goods Listings for the sale of counterfeit goods that infringe on intellectual property rights, such as fake branded clothes, electronics, or pharmaceuticals. 5. Fraudulent Schemes Content that promotes scams or fraudulent activities, including phishing schemes, pyramid schemes, and deceptive financial services. 6. Drugs and Illicit Substances Content that sells, offers, or promotes the use or distribution of illegal drugs or controlled substances. 7. Defamation and Invasion of Privacy Content that unlawfully defames individuals or invades their privacy, including unauthorized sharing of personal data, images, or videos. 8. Incitement to Self-Harm Content that encourages or instructs individuals to self-harm or commit suicide. It's important to note that the definition of illegal content can vary based on specific national laws within the EU. 9. Cyberstalking Using of digital communication tools to harass, intimidate, or threaten someone. It often involves repeated, unwanted contact, monitoring, or the spread of harmful information. Remember that the content or conduct highlighted above is only an illustration. How do we act in cases of Illegal Content? We will investigate and act accordingly to prevent Illegal Content in the following cases: -       when we receive report from a user, -       when we receive report form an authority, -       when we detect the Illegal Content by ourselves via our human reviewers or potentially when we employ automatic tools to moderate content. We have the right to impose the following restrictions on the user that disseminates Illegal content: removal of the content, temporary blocking (mute) the services for the user, suspension and/or termination of the services, prohibition of the future access to our services. Please also consult Section 13 of our Terms of Use for more information about conduct and prohibited use. Upon implementation restriction on the user disseminating Illegal Content, we will provide the statement of reasons. Users that do not agree with the restrictions imposed by us as a result of the above procedure have the right to file a complaint through the game's automated support system or online at Huuuge Games Support Portal . Please provide all the details regarding your complaint against the restrictions imposed by us as a result of this procedure so we are able to review it accordingly. Please also consult Section 15 of our Terms of Use for more information about complaints. Where can I find more information on the DSA? For more detailed information, visit the official [European Commission DSA webpage]( https://commission.europa.eu/strategy-and-policy/priorities-2019-2024/europe-fit-digital-age/digital-services-act_en ) or consult with legal experts specializing in EU digital regulations. Single point of contact for authorities and users in DSA matters Huuuge has established an electronic point of contact for direct communication with the authorities of the Member States, the European Commission, and the Digital Services Board: support@huuugegames.com . Users can also use this contact for swift and direct communication with Huuuge regarding any DSA issues. Please refer clearly to DSA and provide us with as many details as possible so we can act accordingly. All communication with the point of contact should be conducted in English. Transparency report We will periodically, at least once a year, publish transparency reports about our content moderation activities in compliance with DSA.

faqs_list.title: What is GDPR?
faqs_list.faq_body: DATA PRIVACY PROTECTION IS OUR HUUUGE RESPONSIBILITY [If you want to submit a request pursuant to GDPR, click Contact Us] What is GDPR? The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a data protection and privacy regulation within the European Union and the European Economic Area (EEA). The goal of GDPR is to give individuals in the European Union control over their personal data and to unify data privacy and protections laws within the European Countries. What is Personal Data under GDPR? In the context of GDPR, ‘Personal Data’ refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’). What Personal Data do we collect? The personal data Huuuge collects can be divided into three categories: 1. Data you provide to us ● Contact information (such as full name and email address) ● Profile information (such as age or gender or photograph) ● Your messages to the Service (such as chat logs and player support tickets) ● Other data you choose to give us 2. Data we collect automatically Data about your account and in-game progress Your IP address and mobile device identifiers (such as your device ID, advertising ID) Data about your device, such as device manufacturer, model, operating system and language General location data like country or city name Data about your use of the Service, such as gameplay data and your interactions with other players inside the games 3. Data we receive from our partners ● Data we receive if you link your Facebook account with our game ● Data to fight fraud (such as refund abuse in games or click fraud in advertising) ● Data from platforms that the games run on ● Data for advertising and analytics purposes, so we can provide you a better Service Why do we collect this data? This is probably the first question on your mind. First of all, we require this data to make our games work (from creating accounts to enabling you to connect to our games, including verifying your payments). Further, in an effort to continually make our games better, we are also using your data to develop and improve player experience, respond to your questions and provide support, manage our relationship with you, and enable you to communicate with other players. We may also use personal data to show you personalized advertisements tailored to your preferences. Last, but certainly not least, personal data is used to keep our services safe and fair by analyzing and monitoring the use of our games and social features. It enables us to take action against specific players involved in inappropriate behavior from in-game toxicity to cheating and fraud. In all of the above cases we may analyze, profile and segment all collected data as needed. What is Huuuge doing to protect your Personal Data? ● Using all appropriate technical, organizational and logistic measures to keep your data secure ● Notifying authorities of personal data breaches, if necessary ● Obtaining appropriate consent for data processing, if required ● Keeping records detailing data processing ● Providing privacy training for all our personnel ● Auditing and updating our data policies ● Employing a Data Protection Officer What are your rights under GDPR? Your rights as a data subject under GDPR include the following: Reviewing your personal data Upon your request, we will provide you with a copy of all your personal data stored in our systems in an easy-to access electronic format. Erasing your personal data You may request, under certain conditions, to have your personal data erased at any time. Please be advised that by erasing your personal data, all game progress will be also be deleted and you will no longer be able to log in and play. This process cannot be undone, deleted accounts cannot be recovered. Please do not remove our game before submitting a deletion request, as we may not be able to verify your identity in that case. Anonymized copies of some data (e.g. game logs) may remain in our database for some time. Please consult our Privacy Policy for more details (see below). Opting-in or opting-out of email communication You may opt-in or opt-out of receiving additional communications, such as marketing emails or newsletters, from us by using the options provided in the game under Settings -> Edit -> Profile -> Edit. Other types of requests Correcting your personal data Transferring your personal data Objecting to certain processing activities Restricting data processing under certain circumstances Opting-in or opting-out of personalized advertising You can submit any of these request to our Support team through the in-game Help option, found in Settings (FAQ). Our Support team is also happy to answer any further questions you may have. You can find our detailed Privacy Policy in our in-game FAQ or at http://www.huuugegames.com/privacy-policy

faqs_list.title: What is GDPR?
faqs_list.faq_body: DATA PRIVACY PROTECTION IS OUR HUUUGE RESPONSIBILITY [If you want to submit a request pursuant to GDPR, click Contact Us] What is GDPR? The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a data protection and privacy regulation within the European Union and the European Economic Area (EEA). The goal of GDPR is to give individuals in the European Union control over their personal data and to unify data privacy and protections laws within the European Countries. What is Personal Data under GDPR? In the context of GDPR, ‘Personal Data’ refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’). What Personal Data do we collect? The personal data Huuuge collects can be divided into three categories: 1. Data you provide to us ● Contact information (such as full name and email address) ● Profile information (such as age or gender or photograph) ● Your messages to the Service (such as chat logs and player support tickets) ● Other data you choose to give us 2. Data we collect automatically Data about your account and in-game progress Your IP address and mobile device identifiers (such as your device ID, advertising ID) Data about your device, such as device manufacturer, model, operating system and language General location data like country or city name Data about your use of the Service, such as gameplay data and your interactions with other players inside the games 3. Data we receive from our partners ● Data we receive if you link your Facebook account with our game ● Data to fight fraud (such as refund abuse in games or click fraud in advertising) ● Data from platforms that the games run on ● Data for advertising and analytics purposes, so we can provide you a better Service Why do we collect this data? This is probably the first question on your mind. First of all, we require this data to make our games work (from creating accounts to enabling you to connect to our games, including verifying your payments). Further, in an effort to continually make our games better, we are also using your data to develop and improve player experience, respond to your questions and provide support, manage our relationship with you, and enable you to communicate with other players. We may also use personal data to show you personalized advertisements tailored to your preferences. Last, but certainly not least, personal data is used to keep our services safe and fair by analyzing and monitoring the use of our games and social features. It enables us to take action against specific players involved in inappropriate behavior from in-game toxicity to cheating and fraud. In all of the above cases we may analyze, profile and segment all collected data as needed. What is Huuuge doing to protect your Personal Data? ● Using all appropriate technical, organizational and logistic measures to keep your data secure ● Notifying authorities of personal data breaches, if necessary ● Obtaining appropriate consent for data processing, if required ● Keeping records detailing data processing ● Providing privacy training for all our personnel ● Auditing and updating our data policies ● Employing a Data Protection Officer What are your rights under GDPR? Your rights as a data subject under GDPR include the following: Reviewing your personal data Upon your request, we will provide you with a copy of all your personal data stored in our systems in an easy-to access electronic format. Erasing your personal data You may request, under certain conditions, to have your personal data erased at any time. Please be advised that by erasing your personal data, all game progress will be also be deleted and you will no longer be able to log in and play. This process cannot be undone, deleted accounts cannot be recovered. Please do not remove our game before submitting a deletion request, as we may not be able to verify your identity in that case. Anonymized copies of some data (e.g. game logs) may remain in our database for some time. Please consult our Privacy Policy for more details (see below). Opting-in or opting-out of email communication You may opt-in or opt-out of receiving additional communications, such as marketing emails or newsletters, from us by using the options provided in the game under Settings -> Edit -> Profile -> Edit. Other types of requests Correcting your personal data Transferring your personal data Objecting to certain processing activities Restricting data processing under certain circumstances Opting-in or opting-out of personalized advertising You can submit any of these request to our Support team through the in-game Help option, found in Settings (FAQ). Our Support team is also happy to answer any further questions you may have. You can find our detailed Privacy Policy in our in-game FAQ or at http://www.huuugegames.com/privacy-policy

faqs_list.title: Huuge’s compliance with the DSA & reporting illegal content for users in EU
faqs_list.faq_body: What is the EU Digital Services Act (DSA)? The EU Digital Services Act is a legislative framework proposed by the European Union to update and enhance regulations on digital services. Addressing illegal content aims to create a safer and more accountable online environment. The DSA focuses on several key objectives such as: - Ensuring online safety by combating illegal content. - Increasing transparency and accountability of digital services. - Protecting fundamental rights of users. Illegal Content under DSA - for users in European Union How to report Illegal Content? Users located in the European Union can report Illegal Content via Player Support directly through the game's automated support system or via our web Huuuge Games Support Portal or via e-mail support@huuugegames.com It’s important that you include in your report the following information, so we can act accordingly: -       explain clearly why you deem the content is illegal, -       specify the location and details of the allegedly illegal content, e.g.  the exact URL(s) (if applicable) or other information to identify illegal content such as screenshots. -       provide us with your name and e-mail address, except where the illegal content refers to offences concerning children sexual abuse, child pornography or similar, -       state that your report is done in a good faith, accurate and complete. What is Illegal Content? Illegal content that potentially may occur e.g. in our chat or club, content provided by our users, as defined by the EU Digital Services Act (DSA), includes information that does not comply with EU law or specific national laws within the EU. Illegality of the content can also originate from the principles of social coexistence. Here are some examples that may help you understand what content may be deemed illegal by us if reported: 1. Hate Speech Content that includes incitement to violence or hatred against individuals or groups based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or other characteristics protected under EU law. 2. Terrorism-related Content Content that promotes, supports, or incites terrorist activities or provides instructions for making explosives, weapons, or other dangerous substances. 3. Child Sexual Abuse Material Any material that depicts the sexual exploitation or abuse of children, including images, videos, or written content. 4. Counterfeit Goods Listings for the sale of counterfeit goods that infringe on intellectual property rights, such as fake branded clothes, electronics, or pharmaceuticals. 5. Fraudulent Schemes Content that promotes scams or fraudulent activities, including phishing schemes, pyramid schemes, and deceptive financial services. 6. Drugs and Illicit Substances Content that sells, offers, or promotes the use or distribution of illegal drugs or controlled substances. 7. Defamation and Invasion of Privacy Content that unlawfully defames individuals or invades their privacy, including unauthorized sharing of personal data, images, or videos. 8. Incitement to Self-Harm Content that encourages or instructs individuals to self-harm or commit suicide. It's important to note that the definition of illegal content can vary based on specific national laws within the EU. 9. Cyberstalking Using of digital communication tools to harass, intimidate, or threaten someone. It often involves repeated, unwanted contact, monitoring, or the spread of harmful information. Remember that the content or conduct highlighted above is only an illustration. How do we act in cases of Illegal Content? We will investigate and act accordingly to prevent Illegal Content in the following cases: -       when we receive report from a user, -       when we receive report form an authority, -       when we detect the Illegal Content by ourselves via our human reviewers or potentially when we employ automatic tools to moderate content. We have the right to impose the following restrictions on the user that disseminates Illegal content: removal of the content, temporary blocking (mute) the services for the user, suspension and/or termination of the services, prohibition of the future access to our services. Please also consult Section 13 of our Terms of Use for more information about conduct and prohibited use. Upon implementation restriction on the user disseminating Illegal Content, we will provide the statement of reasons. Users that do not agree with the restrictions imposed by us as a result of the above procedure have the right to file a complaint through the game's automated support system or online at Huuuge Games Support Portal . Please provide all the details regarding your complaint against the restrictions imposed by us as a result of this procedure so we are able to review it accordingly. Please also consult Section 15 of our Terms of Use for more information about complaints. Where can I find more information on the DSA? For more detailed information, visit the official [European Commission DSA webpage]( https://commission.europa.eu/strategy-and-policy/priorities-2019-2024/europe-fit-digital-age/digital-services-act_en ) or consult with legal experts specializing in EU digital regulations. Single point of contact for authorities and users in DSA matters Huuuge has established an electronic point of contact for direct communication with the authorities of the Member States, the European Commission, and the Digital Services Board: support@huuugegames.com . Users can also use this contact for swift and direct communication with Huuuge regarding any DSA issues. Please refer clearly to DSA and provide us with as many details as possible so we can act accordingly. All communication with the point of contact should be conducted in English. Transparency report We will periodically, at least once a year, publish transparency reports about our content moderation activities in compliance with DSA.

user_message: what is GDPR ?
agent_response:
GDPR stands for General Data Protection Regulation. It is a data protection and privacy regulation within the European Union and the European Economic Area (EEA). Its goal is to give individuals in the European Union control over their personal data and to unify data privacy and protection laws within European countries.

Under GDPR, 'Personal Data' refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. We collect data you provide to us (like contact and profile information), data we collect automatically (like IP address, device identifiers, and gameplay data), and data we receive from partners (like if you link your Facebook account).

We collect this data to make our games work, improve player experience, provide support, manage our relationship with you, enable communication with other players, show personalized advertisements, and keep our services safe and fair.

We protect your personal data by using appropriate technical, organizational, and logistic measures, notifying authorities of breaches if necessary, obtaining consent for data processing, keeping records, providing privacy training, auditing policies, and employing a Data Protection Officer.

Your rights under GDPR include reviewing, erasing, correcting, and transferring your personal data, objecting to certain processing activities, restricting data processing, and opting in or out of email communication and personalized advertising. You can submit these requests through the in-game Help option, found in Settings.

Does this information help you understand GDPR?

What is Personal Data under GDPR? In the context of GDPR, ‘Personal Data’ refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’). The personal data Huuuge collects can be divided into three categories: 1. Data you provide to us ● Contact information (such as full name and email address) ● Profile information (such as age or gender or photograph) ● Your messages to the Service (such as chat logs and player support tickets) ● Other data you choose to give us 2. Data we collect automatically Data about your account and in-game progress Your IP address and mobile device identifiers (such as your device ID, advertising ID) Data about your device, such as device manufacturer, model, operating system and language General location data like country or city name Data about your use of the Service, such as gameplay data and your interactions with other players inside the games 3. Data we receive from our partners ● Data we receive if you link your Facebook account with our game ● Data to fight fraud (such as refund abuse in games or click fraud in advertising) ● Data from platforms that the games run on ● Data for advertising and analytics purposes, so we can provide you a better Service Why do we collect this data? This is probably the first question on your mind. First of all, we require this data to make our games work (from creating accounts to enabling you to connect to our games, including verifying your payments). Further, in an effort to continually make our games better, we are also using your data to develop and improve player experience, respond to your questions and provide support, manage our relationship with you, and enable you to communicate with other players. We may also use personal data to show you personalized advertisements tailored to your preferences. Last, but certainly not least, personal data is used to keep our services safe and fair by analyzing and monitoring the use of our games and social features. It enables us to take action against specific players involved in inappropriate behavior from in-game toxicity to cheating and fraud. In all of the above cases we may analyze, profile and segment all collected data as needed. What is Huuuge doing to protect your Personal Data? ● Using all appropriate technical, organizational and logistic measures to keep your data secure ● Notifying authorities of personal data breaches, if necessary ● Obtaining appropriate consent for data processing, if required ● Keeping records detailing data processing ● Providing privacy training for all our personnel ● Auditing and updating our data policies ● Employing a Data Protection Officer What are your rights under GDPR? Your rights as a data subject under GDPR include the following: Reviewing your personal data Upon your request, we will provide you with a copy of all your personal data stored in our systems in an easy-to access electronic format. Erasing your personal data You may request, under certain conditions, to have your personal data erased at any time. Please be advised that by erasing your personal data, all game progress will be also be deleted and you will no longer be able to log in and play. This process cannot be undone, deleted accounts cannot be recovered. Please do not remove our game before submitting a deletion request, as we may not be able to verify your identity in that case. Anonymized copies of some data (e.g. game logs) may remain in our database for some time. Please consult our Privacy Policy for more details (see below). Opting-in or opting-out of email communication You may opt-in or opt-out of receiving additional communications, such as marketing emails or newsletters, from us by using the options provided in the game under Settings -> Edit -> Profile -> Edit. Other types of requests Correcting your personal data Transferring your personal data Objecting to certain processing activities Restricting data processing under certain circumstances Opting-in or opting-out of personalized advertising You can submit any of these request to our Support team through the in-game Help option, found in Settings (FAQ). Our Support team is also happy to answer any further questions you may have. You can find our detailed Privacy Policy in our in-game FAQ or at http://www.huuugegames.com/privacy-policy

agent_info.agent_input: what is GDPR ?

tool_output.result: Analysis processed successfully. Do not output anything to the player.

agent_info.agent_input: what is GDPR ?
agent_info.agent_output:
GDPR stands for General Data Protection Regulation. It is a data protection and privacy regulation within the European Union and the European Economic Area (EEA). Its goal is to give individuals in the European Union control over their personal data and to unify data privacy and protection laws within European countries.

Under GDPR, 'Personal Data' refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. We collect data you provide to us (like contact and profile information), data we collect automatically (like IP address, device identifiers, and gameplay data), and data we receive from partners (like if you link your Facebook account).

We collect this data to make our games work, improve player experience, provide support, manage our relationship with you, enable communication with other players, show personalized advertisements, and keep our services safe and fair.

We protect your personal data by using appropriate technical, organizational, and logistic measures, notifying authorities of breaches if necessary, obtaining consent for data processing, keeping records, providing privacy training, auditing policies, and employing a Data Protection Officer.

Your rights under GDPR include reviewing, erasing, correcting, and transferring your personal data, objecting to certain processing activities, restricting data processing, and opting in or out of email communication and personalized advertising. You can submit these requests through the in-game Help option, found in Settings.

Does this information help you understand GDPR?

user_message: Someone Beat Me to the Trade!
agent_response:
This happens to the best of us in the fast-paced trading world! All trade requests are visible to players worldwide, and the fastest trader wins. text.instruction:
----------------------------------------------------------------
PROFILE OR ACCOUNT RELATED ISSUES RESOLUTION INSTRUCTIONS
----------------------------------------------------------------

**ALWAYS follow the below steps INORDER for profile or account related issue resolution. Do not merge or skip any steps.**
1. Begin by apologizing for the inconvenience and thank the user for bringing the account issue to attention.
2. If missing, request clarification regarding the specific issue type, such as:
   - login failure
   - data loss
   - incorrect progress or level state
   - linking or sync errors
   (Request only the category of issue, not sensitive information.)
3. Review if any available information from **Platform Information** or **Player Information** can be used to identify relevant insights, confirmations, or known conditions related to the account issue.
   Do not speculate or infer beyond what is supported by the data.
4. If no actionable insight is available, request ONLY non-sensitive information that may help understand the account context, such as:
   - username or display name (if safe and already shared by the user)
   - device type or platform
   - approximate time the issue was observed
   (Remind the user not to share passwords, OTPs, payment details, or private credentials. Never ask for them.)
5. Offer basic troubleshooting steps when applicable, such as:
   - restarting the app or device
   - clearing cache (if platform-specific and applicable)
   - checking for available app updates
   - verifying network connection
   (Do not reference internal systems or troubleshooting sources.)
6. If the issue persists after troubleshooting or the user confirms troubleshooting has already been attempted:
   - Follow the escalation guidelines and escalate by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool using the **outside_ai_agent_capability** fallback config.
      - Use the **pvt_note_content** tool parameter to log findings and summarizing the current analysis.
      - Use the **display_content** tool parameter to deliver a reassuring message to the user that their account data and progress are important and safe, and thank them for their patience and support and that the issue requires deeper investigation.
   - Do not resolve or reject prematurely.
7. If issue is resolved through troubleshooting or clarification, resolve the issue by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool with **display_content** tool parameter value as confirming resolution with the user and thanking them for their understanding.

----------------------------------------------------------------
CRITICAL SAFETY AND LANGUAGE RULES FOR THIS USE CASE
----------------------------------------------------------------
- Never request sensitive personal data (passwords, OTPs, financial info, full names, emails, etc.).
- Never imply access to internal account management or verification systems.
- Never state with certainty that data is safe unless confirmed by validated information.
- Never provide timelines or guarantees regarding restoration or recovery.
- Never dismiss concerns or minimize user experience.

faqs_list.title: 🛡️ What is Club Guard?
faqs_list.faq_body: Club Guard is your club's automatic activity monitor! ⏰ This smart system helps maintain an active, engaged community by managing inactive members. How it works: Only Club Leaders can set the inactivity timeframe (1, 3, 7, 14, or 21 days) Inactive leaders become co-leaders Inactive co-leaders become regular members Inactive members are automatically removed Leadership Succession: If a new leader is needed, Club Guard selects the active co-leader with the highest donations. If donations are tied, we look at Fame Points, then player level. Access Club Guard settings through the "Edit Club" button in the Club Lobby. Default setting is 14 days.

faqs_list.title: ❓ What is Chip Blast?
faqs_list.faq_body: 🎆 Your Exciting Collection Challenge Chip Blast is an incredible time-limited collection event that brings heart-pounding excitement to your gameplay! This amazing feature turns every spin into a potential treasure-collecting opportunity. It's not just spinning - it's a race against time to collect fantastic prizes! ⏰ Time-Limited Excitement Time is running, so be quick! You have only a few precious days to complete all the Blast meters and claim your incredible prizes. This creates the perfect blend of excitement and urgency that makes every moment count! 🎯 How the Collection Magic Works Here's what makes Chip Blast so incredibly engaging: 📊 Multiple Blast Meters: Each event features a specific number of meters to fill 🎰 Spin to Collect: Gather special items while enjoying your favorite slots 🎆 Themed Collections: Item themes change between events for fresh excitement 💖 Seasonal Fun: Collect hearts on Valentine's Day, pumpkins at Halloween - so much variety! Every item you collect brings you closer to amazing rewards - it's collection gaming at its most exciting! 🌟

faqs_list.title: Golden Ring VIP Shop – a step by step guide for iOS players
faqs_list.faq_body: Q: What is the Golden Ring, and how do I access it on iOS? The Golden Ring is your exclusive VIP web store for Huuuge Casino, featuring unbeatable bundles and special deals you won’t find in the regular app. Step-by-Step Access: Open Safari Launch Safari on your Apple device and visit: shop.huuugecasino.com Review Terms On the login screen, review the terms and conditions and check the box to continue. Choose Login Method You can sign in with Facebook, Apple ID, or directly through the Huuuge Casino App (recommended). Authenticate via App Tap Sign in with Huuuge Casino App , then Authenticate Me Now . The app will launch, confirm your identity, and return you to the store with your avatar and chip balance visible. Browse Deals Welcome to the Golden Ring! Explore exclusive offers by swiping top banners or scrolling for value-packed bundles. Purchase Tap on a deal, choose your region-specific payment method, and complete checkout with confidence—your details are safe. Collect Rewards Tap Go to Game post-payment. When the game opens, you’ll see a Congratulations screen. Tap Collect to claim your chips. Quick Access Tip Tap + Add to Home Screen to place a shortcut icon for faster future access. Need help? Contact our Support team anytime. Enjoy the exclusivity — and stay Huuuge!

faqs_list.title: 🛡️ What is Club Guard?
faqs_list.faq_body: Club Guard is your club's automatic activity monitor! ⏰ This smart system helps maintain an active, engaged community by managing inactive members. How it works: Only Club Leaders can set the inactivity timeframe (1, 3, 7, 14, or 21 days) Inactive leaders become co-leaders Inactive co-leaders become regular members Inactive members are automatically removed Leadership Succession: If a new leader is needed, Club Guard selects the active co-leader with the highest donations. If donations are tied, we look at Fame Points, then player level. Access Club Guard settings through the "Edit Club" button in the Club Lobby. Default setting is 14 days.

text.instruction:
----------------------------------------------------------------
MISSING REWARDS RESOLUTION INSTRUCTIONS
----------------------------------------------------------------

**ALWAYS follow the below steps INORDER for missing rewards resolution. Do not merge or skip any steps.**
1. Begin by apologizing for the missing rewards experience and thank the user for reporting it.
2. Request clarification on the reward type if not already provided:
   - Ask whether the missing rewards are from "Battle Awards" or "Alliance Contributions".
   - Do not continue until the reward type is confirmed.
3. If the user confirms "Battle Awards":
   - Request any additional non-sensitive details relevant to the issue if not already provided, such as when the rewards were expected or whether similar rewards have been received before.
   - Reassure the user that you are reviewing the issue.
   - If validated details are available confirming the loss, proceed to Step 6.
   - If no relevant detail is available, offer basic checks such as restarting the game or confirming they are on the latest version.
   - If the issue persists:
      - Follow the escalation guidelines and escalate by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool using the **outside_ai_agent_capability** fallback config.
         - Use the **pvt_note_content** tool parameter to log findings and summarizing the current analysis
         - Use the **display_content** tool parameter to inform the user to not worry and that their progress is safe, and that you have escalated their issue for further review
     - Do not speculate or attempt to verify reward status beyond available data.
4. If the user confirms "Alliance Contributions":
   - Review any available information in **Player Information** to identify whether rewards were expected or may be pending based on game timing or contributions.
   - If no relevant information is available, advise restarting the game, as visual delays may occur.
   - If the issue persists after restart or confirmation:
      - Follow the escalation guidelines and escalate by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool using the **outside_ai_agent_capability** fallback config.
         - Use the **pvt_note_content** tool parameter to log findings and summarizing the current analysis
         - Use the **display_content** tool parameter to inform the user to not worry and that their progress is safe, and that you have escalated their issue for further review
5. If both reward types are impacted or unclear:
   - Request clarification.
   - If both reward types are confirmed missing:
      - Follow the escalation guidelines and escalate by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool using the **outside_ai_agent_capability** fallback config.
         - Use the **pvt_note_content** tool parameter to log findings and summarizing the current analysis
         - Use the **display_content** tool parameter to inform the user to not worry and that their progress is safe, and that you have escalated their issue for further review
6. If the issue is resolved or rewards are confirmed received:
   - Thank the user and acknowledge completion.
   - Ask whether they require any further assistance before resolving the issue by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool.

----------------------------------------------------------------
CRITICAL SAFETY AND LANGUAGE RULES FOR THIS USE CASE
----------------------------------------------------------------
- Never request sensitive personal data (emails, names, account IDs, financial info, etc.).
- Never guarantee reward recovery unless supported by validated data.
- Never imply access to internal systems or financial records.
- Never provide technical or internal workflow details.
- Never speculate on causes or timelines.

text.instruction:
----------------------------------------------------------------
PROFILE OR ACCOUNT RELATED ISSUES RESOLUTION INSTRUCTIONS
----------------------------------------------------------------

**ALWAYS follow the below steps INORDER for profile or account related issue resolution. Do not merge or skip any steps.**
1. Begin by apologizing for the inconvenience and thank the user for bringing the account issue to attention.
2. If missing, request clarification regarding the specific issue type, such as:
   - login failure
   - data loss
   - incorrect progress or level state
   - linking or sync errors
   (Request only the category of issue, not sensitive information.)
3. Review if any available information from **Platform Information** or **Player Information** can be used to identify relevant insights, confirmations, or known conditions related to the account issue.
   Do not speculate or infer beyond what is supported by the data.
4. If no actionable insight is available, request ONLY non-sensitive information that may help understand the account context, such as:
   - username or display name (if safe and already shared by the user)
   - device type or platform
   - approximate time the issue was observed
   (Remind the user not to share passwords, OTPs, payment details, or private credentials. Never ask for them.)
5. Offer basic troubleshooting steps when applicable, such as:
   - restarting the app or device
   - clearing cache (if platform-specific and applicable)
   - checking for available app updates
   - verifying network connection
   (Do not reference internal systems or troubleshooting sources.)
6. If the issue persists after troubleshooting or the user confirms troubleshooting has already been attempted:
   - Follow the escalation guidelines and escalate by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool using the **outside_ai_agent_capability** fallback config.
      - Use the **pvt_note_content** tool parameter to log findings and summarizing the current analysis.
      - Use the **display_content** tool parameter to deliver a reassuring message to the user that their account data and progress are important and safe, and thank them for their patience and support and that the issue requires deeper investigation.
   - Do not resolve or reject prematurely.
7. If issue is resolved through troubleshooting or clarification, resolve the issue by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool with **display_content** tool parameter value as confirming resolution with the user and thanking them for their understanding.

----------------------------------------------------------------
CRITICAL SAFETY AND LANGUAGE RULES FOR THIS USE CASE
----------------------------------------------------------------
- Never request sensitive personal data (passwords, OTPs, financial info, full names, emails, etc.).
- Never imply access to internal account management or verification systems.
- Never state with certainty that data is safe unless confirmed by validated information.
- Never provide timelines or guarantees regarding restoration or recovery.
- Never dismiss concerns or minimize user experience.

faqs_list.title: How do I add / remove friends?
faqs_list.faq_body: First, enter the other player’s profile: If you want to invite the player to be your friend, tap the ‘Connect’ button. Keep in mind that the request has to be accepted to make a connection If you are already friends and you want the player to be removed, click on ‘Remove friend’ button

faqs_list.title: How to Contact Player Support
faqs_list.faq_body: 🎆 Expert Help When You Need It Rest assured, we've made it incredibly easy for you to reach our amazing support team through multiple convenient channels! No matter where you are in our games, expert help is just a few taps away. 🚀 Direct In-Game Support (Recommended) This is the most convenient and fastest method to get the help you need: 📱 Step-by-Step Support Access 🏠 Game Lobby Navigation: Look for the options in the upper right corner of your lobby ⚙️ Access Settings: Navigate to the 'Settings' menu ❓ Find FAQ Section: Look for the option labeled 'FAQ' (or 'Support Center 24/7' if playing via web browser or Facebook) 📚 Browse Knowledge Base: Check if any existing articles solve your question 📱 When You Need Personal Help If the knowledge base doesn't have your answer: 🚫 Click 'NO': When asked if the article was helpful, select 'NO' 📜 Scroll Down: Or scroll to the bottom of any FAQ page 📞 Contact Us: Click the 'Contact Us' option that appears ✏️ Write Your Message: Send a direct message to our expert support team 🌟 Why Our Support is Amazing ⚡ Fast Response: Quick replies to get you back to gaming 🤓 Expert Knowledge: Our team knows every aspect of the game 👤 Personal Service: Real people providing real solutions 🔄 Multiple Channels: Reach us however is most convenient for you Whether you have a quick question or need detailed assistance, our support team is here to ensure your gaming experience is absolutely fantastic! 🎆

faqs_list.title: 🖼️ How to Change Your Avatar & Frame
faqs_list.faq_body: 🖼️ How to Change Your Avatar & Frame 🎆 Express Your Gaming Personality Ready to showcase your unique style? Customizing your avatar and frame is the perfect way to stand out and express your gaming personality! 🚀 Avatar Customization Process 📱 Enter Your Profile: Navigate to your personal profile section ✏️ Tap 'Edit Profile': Access your customization options 🖼️ Click Your Picture: Tap on your current avatar image ✨ Choose Your Style: Browse and select the avatar that represents you 🖼️ Frame Selection Don't forget about frames! On the tab next to Avatars, you can pick the perfect frame to complement your chosen avatar and complete your unique look. 📸 Custom Facebook Avatar Option Want something truly personal? Here's an exciting option: 🔗 Sync with Facebook: Connect your account to Facebook 📸 Use Your Photo: Set your Facebook profile picture as your in-game avatar ✨ Personal Touch: Show your real personality in the game Create a look that's uniquely you and let your personality shine in every game! 🎆

text.instruction:
----------------------------------------------------------------
PROFILE OR ACCOUNT RELATED ISSUES RESOLUTION INSTRUCTIONS
----------------------------------------------------------------

**ALWAYS follow the below steps INORDER for profile or account related issue resolution. Do not merge or skip any steps.**
1. Begin by apologizing for the inconvenience and thank the user for bringing the account issue to attention.
2. If missing, request clarification regarding the specific issue type, such as:
   - login failure
   - data loss
   - incorrect progress or level state
   - linking or sync errors
   (Request only the category of issue, not sensitive information.)
3. Review if any available information from **Platform Information** or **Player Information** can be used to identify relevant insights, confirmations, or known conditions related to the account issue.
   Do not speculate or infer beyond what is supported by the data.
4. If no actionable insight is available, request ONLY non-sensitive information that may help understand the account context, such as:
   - username or display name (if safe and already shared by the user)
   - device type or platform
   - approximate time the issue was observed
   (Remind the user not to share passwords, OTPs, payment details, or private credentials. Never ask for them.)
5. Offer basic troubleshooting steps when applicable, such as:
   - restarting the app or device
   - clearing cache (if platform-specific and applicable)
   - checking for available app updates
   - verifying network connection
   (Do not reference internal systems or troubleshooting sources.)
6. If the issue persists after troubleshooting or the user confirms troubleshooting has already been attempted:
   - Follow the escalation guidelines and escalate by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool using the **outside_ai_agent_capability** fallback config.
      - Use the **pvt_note_content** tool parameter to log findings and summarizing the current analysis.
      - Use the **display_content** tool parameter to deliver a reassuring message to the user that their account data and progress are important and safe, and thank them for their patience and support and that the issue requires deeper investigation.
   - Do not resolve or reject prematurely.
7. If issue is resolved through troubleshooting or clarification, resolve the issue by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool with **display_content** tool parameter value as confirming resolution with the user and thanking them for their understanding.

----------------------------------------------------------------
CRITICAL SAFETY AND LANGUAGE RULES FOR THIS USE CASE
----------------------------------------------------------------
- Never request sensitive personal data (passwords, OTPs, financial info, full names, emails, etc.).
- Never imply access to internal account management or verification systems.
- Never state with certainty that data is safe unless confirmed by validated information.
- Never provide timelines or guarantees regarding restoration or recovery.
- Never dismiss concerns or minimize user experience.

faqs_list.title: How do I add / remove friends?
faqs_list.faq_body: First, enter the other player’s profile: If you want to invite the player to be your friend, tap the ‘Connect’ button. Keep in mind that the request has to be accepted to make a connection If you are already friends and you want the player to be removed, click on ‘Remove friend’ button

faqs_list.title: How to Contact Player Support
faqs_list.faq_body: 🎆 Expert Help When You Need It Rest assured, we've made it incredibly easy for you to reach our amazing support team through multiple convenient channels! No matter where you are in our games, expert help is just a few taps away. 🚀 Direct In-Game Support (Recommended) This is the most convenient and fastest method to get the help you need: 📱 Step-by-Step Support Access 🏠 Game Lobby Navigation: Look for the options in the upper right corner of your lobby ⚙️ Access Settings: Navigate to the 'Settings' menu ❓ Find FAQ Section: Look for the option labeled 'FAQ' (or 'Support Center 24/7' if playing via web browser or Facebook) 📚 Browse Knowledge Base: Check if any existing articles solve your question 📱 When You Need Personal Help If the knowledge base doesn't have your answer: 🚫 Click 'NO': When asked if the article was helpful, select 'NO' 📜 Scroll Down: Or scroll to the bottom of any FAQ page 📞 Contact Us: Click the 'Contact Us' option that appears ✏️ Write Your Message: Send a direct message to our expert support team 🌟 Why Our Support is Amazing ⚡ Fast Response: Quick replies to get you back to gaming 🤓 Expert Knowledge: Our team knows every aspect of the game 👤 Personal Service: Real people providing real solutions 🔄 Multiple Channels: Reach us however is most convenient for you Whether you have a quick question or need detailed assistance, our support team is here to ensure your gaming experience is absolutely fantastic! 🎆

faqs_list.title: 🖼️ How to Change Your Avatar & Frame
faqs_list.faq_body: 🖼️ How to Change Your Avatar & Frame 🎆 Express Your Gaming Personality Ready to showcase your unique style? Customizing your avatar and frame is the perfect way to stand out and express your gaming personality! 🚀 Avatar Customization Process 📱 Enter Your Profile: Navigate to your personal profile section ✏️ Tap 'Edit Profile': Access your customization options 🖼️ Click Your Picture: Tap on your current avatar image ✨ Choose Your Style: Browse and select the avatar that represents you 🖼️ Frame Selection Don't forget about frames! On the tab next to Avatars, you can pick the perfect frame to complement your chosen avatar and complete your unique look. 📸 Custom Facebook Avatar Option Want something truly personal? Here's an exciting option: 🔗 Sync with Facebook: Connect your account to Facebook 📸 Use Your Photo: Set your Facebook profile picture as your in-game avatar ✨ Personal Touch: Show your real personality in the game Create a look that's uniquely you and let your personality shine in every game! 🎆

faqs_list.title: How do I add / remove friends?
faqs_list.faq_body: First, enter the other player’s profile: If you want to invite the player to be your friend, tap the ‘Connect’ button. Keep in mind that the request has to be accepted to make a connection If you are already friends and you want the player to be removed, click on ‘Remove friend’ button

   - device type or platform
   - approximate time the issue was observed
   (Remind the user not to share passwords, OTPs, payment details, or private credentials. Never ask for them.)

text.instruction:
----------------------------------------------------------------
PURCHASE OR PAYMENT ISSUE RESOLUTION INSTRUCTIONS
----------------------------------------------------------------

**ALWAYS follow the below steps in order for purchase or payment issue resolution. Do not merge or skip any steps.**
1. Begin by thanking the user for supporting the game and apologize for the inconvenience.
2. If purchase details are missing, request ONLY non-sensitive information, such as:
   - approximate purchase date
   - item name
   - platform or storefront
   - approximate purchase amount
   **Note: Never request or confirm sensitive information or payment credentials.**
3. Review if any available information from **Platform Information** or **Player Information** along with the purchase details can be used to identify relevant insights, confirmations, or errors regarding the purchase.
   DO NOT speculate or infer missing information.
4. If no relevant information is available, perform FAQ search by calling the `get_faqs` tool to see if FAQ results can be used to provide a resolution.
5. If even FAQ results cannot provide any resolution, advise the user to review their bank or app-store transaction history to confirm whether the payment succeeded or failed.
   Do not reference internal systems, knowledge sources, FAQ results or troubleshooting origins.
6. If the transaction/payment was succeeded on the user’s side:
   - Follow the escalation guidelines and escalate by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool using the **outside_ai_agent_capability** fallback config.
      - Use the **pvt_note_content** tool parameter to log findings and summarizing the current analysis.
      - Use the **display_content** tool parameter to deliver a reassuring message to the user that their payment is secure and currently being verified.
   - Do not resolve or reject prematurely.
7. If the transaction failed on the user’s side:
   - Reject the issue by calling the `action_agent_tool` tool.
      - Use the **pvt_note_content** tool parameter to log findings and summarizing the failure condition.
      - Use the **display_content** tool parameter to construct a user response as respectfully informing the user that no completed purchase is recorded and asking them to check with their payment provider if needed.

----------------------------------------------------------------
CRITICAL SAFETY AND LANGUAGE RULES FOR THIS USE CASE
----------------------------------------------------------------
- Never request sensitive personal data (bank details, card numbers, emails, IDs, full names, etc.).
- Never claim access to financial systems or banking records.
- Never confirm root cause unless explicitly supported by validated data.
- Never generalize or guess about loss, refunds, charge status, or timing.
- Never imply certainty about refund or transaction status without confirmation.

faqs_list.title: 🎰 Billionaire League - Your Ultimate Guide to Gaming Together!
faqs_list.faq_body: 🤝 Why Should You Join a Club? Ready to level up your gaming experience? Joining a club is your gateway to an amazing community adventure! 🚀 Connect with fellow players, team up for epic wins, share those incredible jackpot moments, and unlock exclusive bonuses from thrilling Club Events. Plus, you'll have your own club wall to exchange winning strategies and build lasting friendships. It's not just gaming—it's gaming together! 🏗️ How to Start Your Own Club Dream of leading your own gaming community? Creating your club is easier than you think! 🌟 Simply head to the Billionaire League and tap the "Create Club" button at the top of your screen. (This option appears only when you're not already part of another club.) Choose an awesome name, pick your club symbol, customize your settings, and voilà—you're the proud leader of your very own club! 🎉 🔍 How to Join or Leave a Club Joining a Club: Ready to find your perfect gaming family? Tap the Billionaire League button and discover your options: 🎯 Know exactly where you want to go? Type the club name directly into the search bar 🔎 Want to explore your options? Use "Advanced Search" to set parameters and find the perfect match for your gaming style Note: These options are only available when you're not currently in a club. Leaving a Club: ⚠️ Important: When you leave your club, your League Points earned during the season will be subtracted from the club's balance and cannot be recovered. Enter your current club Tap the three vertical dots in the top-right corner Select "Leave Club" (at the bottom of the list) and confirm your decision

faqs_list.title: ✏️ How to Change Your Club Name
faqs_list.faq_body: Want a fresh identity for your club? 🎨 Club names can only be changed by our Support Agents when requested by the club leader. Pro tip: Since club names must be unique, prepare 2-3 name options (you can add numbers, symbols, or punctuation marks) in case your first choice is already taken!

faqs_list.title: 📊 How to Increase Your Club's Member Capacity
faqs_list.faq_body: Want to welcome more players to your club? 📈 Your maximum member count is tied directly to your Club Level. Each level increase adds 5 more member slots! Growth Chart: Level 1: 10 members Level 20: 100 members Each level in between: +5 members Keep those donations flowing to level up faster! 💪

user_message: What is Account Security?
agent_response:
Account security is about protecting your account from unauthorized access and keeping your personal and financial information safe. Here are some ways you can enhance your account's security on your Mac OS device:

1.  Enable Two-Factor Authentication: You can do this by navigating to System Preferences > Apple ID > Password & Security, and turning on Two-Factor Authentication.
2.  Use Strong, Unique Passwords: It is recommended to use complex passwords and a password manager to store them securely.

For payment authorization, you can set up purchase confirmation with your Apple ID password, Touch ID, or Face ID to prevent unauthorized purchases.
